fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025.bases

Interface AdjustableCI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdjustableConnector, AdjustableOutboundPort, HeaterConnector

    public interface AdjustableCI
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI
    The component interface AdjustableCI defines the standardised operation that an equipment implements to let a household energy manager adjust or suspend them i.e., making their electric power consumption the lowest possible.

    Description

    An adjustable equipment is an electric equipment that can be suspended and resumed. When suspended, it operates at the lowest possible level of power consumption. In some cases, they may provide several distinct operative modes that are designated by integers from 1 to maxMode() that make it operate at increasing levels of power consumption.

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2023-09-12

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      int currentMode()
      return the current mode of operation of the equipment.
      boolean downMode()
      force the equipment to the next less energy consuming mode of operation, returning true if the operation succeeded or false otherwise.
      double emergency()
      return the degree of emergency of a resumption for the previously suspended equipment.
      double getModeConsumption(int modeIndex)
      return the power consumption in amperes of the appliance when in the mode modeIndex.
      int maxMode()
      return the largest mode value that can be returned by currentMode.
      boolean resume()
      resume the previously suspended equipment, returning true if the resumption succeeded or false otherwise.
      boolean setMode(int modeIndex)
      set the equipment to the given mode of operation, returning true if the operation succeeded or false otherwise.
      boolean suspend()
      suspend the equipment, returning true if the suspension succeeded or false otherwise.
      boolean suspended()
      return true if the equipment has been suspended and false otherwise.
      boolean upMode()
      force the equipment to the next more energy consuming mode of operation, returning true if the operation succeeded or false otherwise.

      • getModeConsumption

        double getModeConsumption(int modeIndex)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        return the power consumption in amperes of the appliance when in the mode modeIndex.

        Description

        According to the good practices for cyber-physical systems, the result of this method should be of type Measure<Double>, as it represents a physical value with a measurement unit. But, as one of the objective of the project is to generate the code of connectors, the limitations of Javassist, the tool used to generate code at run time, that can only compile Java 4 code, it would cause complications to use a class with a generic type.

        Contract

         pre     modeIndex > 0 && modeIndex <= maxMode()
 post    return >= 0.0
        Parameters:
        modeIndex - index of the new mode of operation.
        Returns:
        the power consumption in amperes of the appliance when in the mode modeIndex.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
